page.title: 04PEAK NATIONAL PARK
page.content: The Peak National Park is South of the Pennine hills which run down Northern England.There is more of the National Park in Derbyshire than in any other place in the country but it is extended to Cheshire and Staffordshire In the Peak District there are two kinds of country.The Northern part is made up of flat moorlands.It is covererd with heather and peat bog.Not many people live there.The highest point is kinder(612 metres).Dry limestone hills are mostly in the southern part.It attracts many visitors because of its beautiful scenery and the rivers are good for fishing.The Peak District has been declared a National park to keep it a holiday place and preserve it from industrial towns.Rowarth is in the middle of the Peak District and Thonsett is on the border.
